intro: Angolluma schweinfurthii, commonly known as the African orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces inflorescences with multiple flowers arranged in a spike. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
